questions.question_text: Which of the following can be used to identify users after an action has occurred?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Cameras

Cameras can be used to identify users after an action has occurred. They provide visual records of activities, allowing for post-event analysis and identification of individuals involved in specific incidents.
What about motion detectors? They only active after an action has occurred.

Selected Answer: B
Cameras will provide a visual identification of the individual who performed the action.

comments.content: Thought about it again I'm going for B cameras

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Asset tag

Asset tags can be used to identify users after an action has occurred. Asset tags are typically attached to physical assets, such as computers or equipment. By associating assets with specific users or locations, organizations can use asset tags to track and identify users who have interacted with or have been responsible for particular assets. This can be useful for inventory management, security, and auditing purposes.

questions.question_text: Which of the following standards would apply to a 10GB network link that is 1.86mi (3km)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. 10GBASE-LR

10GBASE-LR is a standard for 10 Gigabit Ethernet over single-mode fiber that can support distances up to 10 kilometers, making it suitable for a network link that is 1.86 miles (approximately 3 kilometers) long. This standard is designed for long-range communication, which is required in the scenario provided.

questions.question_text: Which of the following kinds of targeted attacks uses multiple computers or bots to request the same resource repeatedly?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A DDoS makes the most sense because in a DDoS attack, the threat actor uses multiple computers that are infected to constantly make requests to a server which overwhelms it and causes network interruption.

Selected Answer: B
B. MAN

The service provider set up a Metropolitan Area Network (MAN). A MAN typically covers a larger geographical area than a Local Area Network (LAN), such as a city or town, and is used to connect multiple locations within that area. In this case, connecting 20 schools in a large city with a fiber-optic network fits the definition of a MAN, as it spans a metropolitan area and involves multiple buildings or sites.

Selected Answer: B
B. MAN (Metropolitan Area Network)

When a local service provider connects multiple schools in a large city with a fiber-optic switched network, the network type set up is a Metropolitan Area Network (MAN). A MAN covers a larger geographical area than a Local Area Network (LAN) but is smaller in scale compared to a Wide Area Network (WAN). MANs are designed to connect entities within a metropolitan or city area.

questions.question_text: A local service provider connected 20 schools in a large city with a fiber-optic switched network. Which of the following network types did the provider set up?

A systems administrator is looking for operating system information, running services, and network ports that are available on a server. Which of the following software tools should the administrator use to accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Failing to see how netstat is the right answer. Question is asking for OS Info too, I can not find a way to find OS info with netstat. NMAP can do everything the question is asking for however.

Selected Answer: B
For a specific recommendation, Nmap is particularly well-suited for a comprehensive scan that covers operating system details, running services, and open ports on a server. Its ability to perform both host discovery and port scanning makes it a versatile tool for network administrators and security professionals alike.
This is one of those questions where if you ask ChatGPT, it will give you one answer the first time then will give you another if you ask the same question a second time

comments.content: :D As you said, first time its netstat and then 2nd time it went to NMAP

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Nmap CAN fingerprint a system's OS in addition to all the other requirements listed here. Netstat CANNOT.
Trash question both nmap and netstat do this.

comments.content: Netstat doesn't directly infer OS info, unless you see something like port 3389 (RDP) then you won't know the OS

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. netstat.

Netstat (network statistics) is a command-line tool used to display network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections, and multicast memberships. It provides information about the network connections (both incoming and outgoing), routing tables, and network interface statistics, which can help the systems administrator in understanding the operating system information, running services, and network ports that are available on the server.

Selected Answer: D
The software tool that the systems administrator should use to gather information about operating system details, running services, and network ports on a server is D. netstat
